alert.note: Alert for Cayuga; Schuyler; Seneca; Steuben; Tompkins; Yates (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 02 at 10:06PM EST until February 02 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southern Seneca County in central New York... Schuyler County in central New York... Yates County in central New York... Southern Cayuga County in central New York... Steuben County in central New York... Northwestern Tompkins County in central New York... * Until 1100 PM EST. * At 1006 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Geneva to near Dansville to 7 miles south of Ashford, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Hornell, Bath, Penn Yan, Hector, Romulus, Starkey, Campbell, Benton, Urbana and Canisteo. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 34 North and 41. Interstate 390 between 1 and 3. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.

area.areaDesc: Cayuga; Schuyler; Seneca; Steuben; Tompkins; Yates
